meanings.definition: The state or quality of being haploid.
meanings.sent1: Haploidy is when an organism has only one set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study haploidy to understand genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in laughter when the teacher explained haploidy with a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, haploidy is like having a solo performer on stage.
meanings.sent5: The concept of haploidy can be as simple as a single puzzle piece completing the picture.

meanings.definition: The condition of having a single set of unpaired chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: Haploidy is important in the process of cell division.
meanings.sent2: During meiosis, haploidy plays a crucial role in creating gametes.
meanings.sent3: The genetic counselor joked that haploidy was like having a solo chromosome party.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic world, haploidy is akin to a lone traveler exploring uncharted territories.
meanings.sent5: The uniqueness of haploidy can be compared to a single star shining brightly in the night sky.
